howToUse.title: How to Use the BMI Calculator

inputFields.title: Input Fields
items: Select your preferred unit system (metric or imperial)
Enter your current weight in kilograms or pounds
Enter your height in centimeters or inches
The calculator will automatically update your BMI result

items.description: BMI = weight (kg) / height (m)² or weight (lbs) / height (in)² × 703
Underweight, Normal weight, Overweight, and Obese classifications
Recommended weight range for your height based on BMI 18.5-24.9

tips.title: Tips for Accurate Results
items: Weigh yourself in the morning on an empty stomach
BMI is a screening tool, not a diagnostic measure
Consult healthcare professionals for personalized advice

formula.title: BMI Formula
formula.description: BMI is calculated by dividing your weight in kilograms by the square of your height in meters. For imperial units, the formula is adjusted with a conversion factor of 703.

categories.title: BMI Categories
categories.description: BMI categories help classify weight status: Underweight (BMI < 18.5), Normal weight (BMI 18.5-24.9), Overweight (BMI 25.0-29.9), and Obese (BMI ≥ 30.0) with further subdivisions for obesity classes.

limitations.title: BMI Limitations
limitations.description: BMI doesn't distinguish between muscle and fat mass, so athletes may have high BMI despite being healthy. It also doesn't account for age, sex, ethnicity, or body composition. BMI is best used as a screening tool alongside other health assessments.
